1.name: Undying Rage
1.details:
Berserker gains a stack of Undying Rage each time he basic attacks an enemy (maximum 10 stacks). In addition, when Berserker falls below a certain threshold of health, he will recover a percentage of his health over a duration.

The number of stacks will affect the amount of health recovered and Berserker's other abilities.

2.name: Fearless
2.details:
Berserker leaps up and lands down in a target direction, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power) to all enemies hit and briefly slowing them.

At maximum stacks of Undying Rage, Fearless will deal more damage and knock up the enemies instead.

3.name: Asura’s Wrath
3.details:
Berserker gains a number of Undying Rage stacks and increases his attack speed for 6 seconds.

If the number of stacks are already maxed out, Berserker gains increased life steal and attack speed instead.

4.name: Shear
4.details: Berserker reaps the enemy, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power). At maximum stacks of Undying Rage, Shear will deal true damage instead.

5.name: Unforgivable
5.details:
On first cast, Berserker breaks out of any crowd control he is currently on, marks all enemy Heroes who recently damage him for a duration and gains increased movement speed towards them.

On second cast, Berserker leaps at a nearby target enemy Hero whom he has marked, dealing a percentage of the enemy's missing health as physical damage (scaling with physical power).

At maximum stacks of Undying Rage, Berserker also gains immunity to movement speed reduction.
